subject: Education
title: Collaborative Learning vs Group Work
description: A micro-lesson that makes Collaborative Learning vs Group Work usable.

hook.text: Group projects where one person does everything aren't collaborationâ€”they're delegation.

buildup.text: True collaborative learning requires shared goals with individual accountability.

discovery.text: Johnson and Johnson showed that structured collaboration outperforms both competition and solo work.

twist.text: Unstructured groups often produce social loafing and unequal participation.

climax.text: Roles, checkpoints, and shared products turn a group into a team.

punchline.text: Collaboration is a skill, not a seating arrangement.

quiz.question: What separates true collaboration from mere group work?
options: Shared goals with individual accountability and structure
Working in the same room at the same time
